subject: Web3
title: Stablecoins as Savings Accounts
description: One-minute skill: Stablecoins as Savings Accounts.

hook.text: In countries with hyperinflation, holding stablecoins is like having a dollar savings account without needing a US bank.

buildup.text: In Argentina, the peso lost over 100% of its value in 2023. Residents who held USDT preserved their purchasing power.

discovery.text: Stablecoins earn yield through DeFi protocols. A Nigerian holding USDC on Aave can earn interest unavailable in local banks.

twist.text: Governments in these countries sometimes restrict crypto access. People use peer-to-peer trading to circumvent the bans.

climax.text: For billions of people, stablecoins aren't speculative â€” they're survival tools against broken financial systems.

punchline.text: Not investing. Not speculating. Just trying to keep what they've earned.

quiz.question: Why do people in high-inflation countries use stablecoins?
options: To preserve purchasing power when local currency loses value rapidly
